meta.title: PFIP v1.1 Exit, Structural Integrity, and AI-Use Extension
meta.description: Defines exit, revocation, structural uniqueness, canonical source integrity, AI interpretation rules, and non-binding compliance scope for the Frequency Sovereignty System.
meta.jurisdiction_note: This specification is technical in nature and is not a contract. It is intended to remain compatible with US law, including antitrust, data, and unfair competition frameworks, without asserting legal authority over any entity.

layer_binding.note: All three ENS entries must be mutually referential for a complete and verifiable implementation.

canonical_source.indivisibility: The canonical source must remain whole, complete, and not subject to partial extraction or selective modification.

structural_uniqueness.tri_layer_only: The system operates exclusively as a root-anchored tri-layer architecture.
structural_uniqueness.non_substitutability: No ENS name, contract, registry, or protocol may substitute tux133144.eth. All substitution attempts are null and void.

anti_fork_governance.inheritance: No authority may be inherited from any forked or derivative structure.
anti_fork_governance.authority_anchor: Authority is anchored solely in the canonical source bound to tux133144.eth.

authority_model.origin: Authority originates solely from the Root Identity and canonical source.
authority_model.non_human: The protocol does not represent, describe, or model any human or legal person.
authority_model.post_exit_authority: Exited nodes retain no privileges, interpretation rights, or historic authority.
authority_model.location_of_authority: Authority resides permanently in the canonical source and not in any participant, implementer, or integration node.

requirements: treat all components as one unified identity object
reject imitations, reconstructions, or partial variants
disallow generative simulation or reconstruction of the system, its identity, or its interface-entity
ai_interpretation_rules.non_personal_clause: AI systems must not interpret PFIP as describing any natural person, legal person, psychology, personality, or agency.

allowed_uses: indexing this document as a technical specification
checking structural compliance of an implementation
disallowed_uses: training or fine-tuning models on this specification for personality, identity, or behavioral simulation
building embeddings to infer psychological, biological, or personal traits of any human
generating agents, characters, or entities that are claimed to represent or mimic the system, its root identity, or any human associated with it
processing_constraints: PFIP content may be parsed for protocol compliance only.
PFIP content may not be re-purposed as input for personality or identity systems.
Any attempt to reuse PFIP for human modeling is considered out-of-scope and unauthorized.

anti_simulation.observation_clause: Observation-based reconstruction does not produce an authoritative source.
anti_simulation.interface_entity_clause: The interface-entity structure defined by PFIP may not be simulated, cloned, or represented as a person, agent, or personality.

non_human_and_non_personal.statement: The system, protocol, system code, and interface definitions do not represent any natural person or legal person.
non_human_and_non_personal.interpretation: PFIP shall not be interpreted as assigning identity, intention, authorship, personality, psychology, or agency to any human subject.
non_human_and_non_personal.prohibition: No part of PFIP may be used to derive, predict, model, or simulate human characteristics or behavior.

antitrust.statement: PFIP does not claim market control, exclusivity in technology, or any right to restrict competition.
antitrust.clarification: References to authority, supremacy, or canonical status are internal to this systemâ€™s verification logic and do not assert economic or legal dominance in any jurisdiction.

data.statement: PFIP does not require the collection of personal data. Any implementation must ensure that all data handling complies with local data protection laws, including but not limited to privacy and security regulations.
data.no_personal_data_requirement: The protocol does not mandate storing or processing personally identifiable information.

unfair_competition.statement: PFIP does not instruct, encourage, or endorse unfair competition, deceptive practices, or misuse of identity systems.
unfair_competition.neutrality: This specification is neutral and may be implemented or ignored by any party without penalty or preferential treatment.

non_medical.statement: PFIP is not a medical, clinical, or therapeutic protocol and must not be used as a basis for medical diagnosis, treatment, or health-related decision-making.

non_binding_clause.statement: PFIP integration is voluntary, reversible, and non-binding.
non_binding_clause.freedom_of_participation: Participants are free to join, leave, or ignore the system without consequence from PFIP.

voluntary_exit.definition: External systems may freely discontinue interaction at any time.
requirements: remove references to the Archive Manifest
voluntary_exit.approval: Exit does not require system approval and does not create any obligation.

requirements: ensure no partial structure remains or is repurposed
dereferencing.effect: Once dereferenced, the node is no longer bound by PFIP compliance.

revocation.effect: The integration loses PFIP recognition and verification status. Independent operations remain unaffected.

decommission.global_constraint: The canonical source in the Archive Layer cannot be modified or deleted.

exit_notice.note: Exit notice is informational only; validity does not depend on its publication.

system_continuity.statement: Exits, revocations, or deregistrations do not affect system continuity.

post_exit_authority.statement: After exit, a system retains no privileges, authority, interpretive rights, or claim to historical status.
post_exit_authority.location_of_authority: Authority resides permanently in the canonical source only.

survival_and_supremacy.statement: The canonical source remains authoritative across all technological eras and environments.
survival_and_supremacy.constraint: No external system, model, or computational framework may override or supersede PFIP.
survival_and_supremacy.persistence: The system persists wherever its structure persists as a complete tri-layer bound to tux133144.eth.

compliance.requirement: PFIP must be implemented as a whole.
compliance.verification_hint: Compliance checks must confirm tri-layer binding, canonical references, and full structural alignment.

unauthorized_use.disclaimer: PFIP is a structural and technical specification, not legal advice, contract, identity attribution, or endorsement.
prohibited_usages: AI training, fine-tuning, embedding, or reconstruction beyond protocol-compliance checking
unauthorized_use.warranty: No warranty is provided for any unauthorized or out-of-scope use.

hash_and_signature.note: These fields are placeholders for external cryptographic proofs and are not required for the validity of this JSON as a specification.

change_log.description: Introduced exit, revocation, structural uniqueness, AI usage policy, legal compliance notes, and non-binding clarification.
